item.title: Hostel Life: The chronicles of my Second Home
item.description: The word “home” conjures up images of comfort, safety, and familiarity. It’s a place where one can unwind, be themselves, and find solace in the company of loved ones. But what happens when we leave this cocoon-like environment to venture into the unknown?

item.title: To be happy
item.description: To be happy is a matter of choice We need to be free Free from the prison of our own thoughts Escaping from the demon inside us And illuminating darkness from our light Pain will always be there lurking Feeding our memories

item.title: Lines of Nostalgia
item.description: If you carry your childhood with you, you never become older. - Tom Stoppard

item.title: The One Who Remains Standing
item.description: ‚ÄúI am not free while any woman is unfree, even when her shackles are very different from my own. - Audre Lorde

item.title: My Pillar
item.description:
Tears in my dad’s eyes
He was always my pillar when I knew I’d fall,
Always my anchor so strong and tall.
His hard face changes only for me.

item.title: Wo ladka ab badal gya h
Academic Burnout in Medical Students: Signs and Prevention
item.description: What is it? Signs of academic burnout Academic burnout among medical students Why do medical students suffer more? How can you prevent it? How to help yourself?¬†Do you experience a lack of motivation? Being drained and agitated? You’re not as inspired or as imaginative in your schoolwork as you used to be.

item.title: Lady and the lotus
item.description: ‚ÄúIf you know how to make good use of the mud, you can grow beautiful lotuses.‚Äù ‚ÄìThich Nhat Hanh

item.title: Radha Krishna - An eternal love
item.description: To love without condition, to talk without intention, to give without reason, care without expectation, that is the spirit of true love - Lord Krishna

item.title: You are not what you look like
item.description: You are not what you look like. You’re the music you listen to, the shows you watch, the art you make, the flowers in your hair & the warmth of your favourite blanket. You’re not the pimple on your nose or pudge on your tummy.

item.title: Partial
item.description: ‚ÄúShe wore flowers in her hair and carried magic secrets in her eyes. - Arundhati Roy

item.title: Om Ganpati namo namah!
item.description: May Lord Ganesha, the Vighnharta, remove all obstacles and sorrows from our lives.

item.title: Colorful wings and fearless eyes
item.description: She trusted her own wings and hence was never afraid of the strength of the branch

item.title: The first man to climb Mt. Everest
item.description: To travel, to experience, and to learn; that is to live. - Tenzing Norgay

item.title: Hills, snow and a beautiful creature.
item.description: We like to stay warm, let the polar bears live cold.

item.title: Her: the Rainbow
item.description: She comes in colours everywhere She combs her hair She's like a rainbow Coming, colours in the air Oh, everywhere She comes in colours - Rolling stones

item.title: The Dreaming Eye
item.description: a symbol of good, evil, protection, vision, knowledge, wisdom and mystery.

item.title: Togetherness
item.description: And the finest of conventions ever held beneath the sun Are the little family gatherings when the busy day is done. - Edgar A. Guest

item.title: Exhilaration
item.description: My mind to me a kingdom is; Such present joys therein I find, That it excels all other bliss That earth affords or grows by kind: - Edward Dyer

item.title: Green eyes and blue feathers
item.description: The fountain sang and sang And on the marble rim The milk-white peacocks slept, Their dreams were strange and dim. - Sara Teasdale

item.title: Donald duck
item.description: If excitement had a face.

item.title: The legend Hanuman
item.description: Lord Mahadev is reborn as Hanuman to serve Lord Rama, and becomes a beacon of hope amidst the harrowing darkness.

item.title: Bugsy
item.description: ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt take life too seriously. You‚Äôll never get out alive!‚Äù ‚Äî Bugs Bunny

item.title: Where Everything Unites
item.description:
You divide the world,
in black and white.
But did you ever consider the grey,
where everything unites?

item.title: The Sound of Silence
item.description:
The words that are spoken,
the emotions that are not.
The biggest truths that we write,
but the secrets that only remain an ink blot.

item.title: The red adieu
item.description: It is a beauteous evening, calm and free, The holy time is quiet as a Nun Breathless with adoration; the broad sun Is sinking down in its tranquility; - William Wordsworth

item.title: Colors of dusk
item.description: a changing sky, dabbled in the orange and red of a setting sun, glazing with its precious hues - Nikita Gill

item.title: God is a woman
item.description: So amazing how this world was made I wonder if GOD is a woman The gift of life astounds me to this day I give it up for the woman -Shaggy

item.title: Life cycle of a medico
item.description: ...is like riding a bicycle. To keep your balance, you must keep moving. - Einstein

item.title: Rat in a jar
item.description: Sahira is my closest friend. We used to share all our experiences but once, she was in real trouble. It all started with that one concert. Sahira was getting late for the concert as she was sleeping all day. All her friends including me always insisted she maintains a routine, but she never listened.

item.title: Full moon night
item.description: "Always remember we are under the same sky, looking at the same moon." ‚ÄîMaxine Lee

item.title: A Bunch of Red Roses
item.description: No arrogant jewel sits enthroned on her forehead Or swings from a white ear for all men to see But stars in the deep of her eyes are exclaiming I carry a rich bunch of red roses for thee -The Dubliners

item.title: The Forest Path
item.description: The clearest way into the universe is through a forest wilderness - John Muir

item.title: World TB day observed at GMC, Ratlam
item.description: World TB day 2023 was observed at Government Medical College Ratlam on 24th March under the aegis of Department of Community Medicine. View post on imgur.com Various competitons were held for undergraduates, nursing and paramedical staff. View post on imgur.com Dr.

item.title: The Dusty Attic
item.description: ‚ÄúIt was strange. No matter how much I think about it, it still is. How can I end up in that attic every night ? John says I am probably sleep-walking and told me to consult a doctor. But I am not!
